channel.title: Why is delta nulling itself? gah
channel.description: I havent tried to run my own server in a while, but i was on a bunch of servers, and i see alot of things that can be changed to make an awesome server, except when in open runserver.bat in delta, it just nulls itself to hell. Ugh, why?

item.title: Why is delta nulling itself? gah
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:7, topic:236226”][quote author=codyganzell link=topic=311655.msg2485016#msg2485016 date=1223764888]
So I ctr+f !connectedFrom.startsWith(“adsl-99”)){

And then delete what you first posted, all of it?
[/quote]
Yes.

seriously…

@Jordie -

Just make a tutorial so that i can post the link on all the stupid delta nuller questions.

Yeah but it’d be under 5 minutes lol.[/quote]then make a mini tut in this thread, and ill use the quote link for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is delta nulling itself? gah
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

It’s in client.java. ;).
Just ctrl + f;

!connectedFrom.startsWith("adsl-99")){

Then you’ll see the rest of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is delta nulling itself? gah
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Remove the anti null.
Here’s a hint;

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("delta") && !connectedFrom.equals("127.0.0.1") && !connectedFrom.startsWith("adsl-99")){ println("Not from localhost!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; savefile = false; return; }
